newsitem.title: USA: AMR orders 103 Boeing jets, has options for more.
newsitem.headline: AMR orders 103 Boeing jets, has options for more.

text.p: AMR Corp's American Airlines Thursday confirmed it had placed an order for 103 Boeing Co aircraft and purchase rights for 527 additional planes.
Under the deal, Boeing will be American's exclusive aircraft supplier through the year 2018.
American said it will take delivery of the 103 aircraft over four years starting in 1998.
The order consists of aircraft models ranging from Boeing 737s to 777s, with the bulk of the order and purchase rights consisting of 737s, it said.
The deal is contingent on ratification of the tentative labor pact between American and the Allied Pilots Association, whose 9,150 members will vote on the agreement in December.
On Wednesday the APA board voted 10 to eight to accept the pact.
Boeing said the list price for the 103 aircraft is $6.6 billion. List prices begin at $32-$39 million for each 737-600 ordered and run to $128-$146 million for each of 12 777s.
American has also ordered four 767-300ERs that range in price from $97 to $107 million, and 12 757-200s publicly priced from $61 to $68 million.
American said the flexibility provided by "purchase rights" for additional aircraft is a key element in the deal.
"The agreement will enable us to acquire the aircraft we need while avoiding the need to make larger firm commitments, thus preserving the strength of our balance sheet," the company said.
The rights let American buy new aircraft with as little as 15 to 18 months' prior notice and choose among a mix of models. American said traditional options require 24 to 36 months.
American said the agreement also includes broad price protection provisions that ensure it will not be commercially disadvantaged as to aircraft prices for more than two decades.
The company said it is negotiating with manufacturers for engines to power the 777s.
